riemann_stats_py package¶

Submodules¶

riemann_stats_py.data_processing module¶

class riemann_stats_py.data_processing.DataProcessing[source]¶

Bases: object

Class for handling data loading and preparation.

This class offers static methods to read CSV files and convert them into DataFrames, facilitating data analysis in data science projects.

static load_data(filepath: str, separator: str = ';', decimal: str = '.') → DataFrame[source]¶

Loads data from a CSV file and returns a DataFrame.

This method reads a CSV file using the pandas library. It allows specifying the delimiter and the decimal character, with default values provided for ease of use.

Parameters:

  • filepath (str) – Path to the CSV file.

  • separator (str, optional) – Delimiter used in the CSV file. Defaults to “;”.

  • decimal (str, optional) – Character used for decimal points in the CSV file. Defaults to “.”.

Returns:

A DataFrame containing the data loaded from the CSV file.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

riemann_stats_py.riemannian_umap_analysis module¶

class riemann_stats_py.riemannian_umap_analysis.RiemannianUMAPAnalysis(data: ndarray | DataFrame, n_neighbors: int = 3, min_dist: float = 0.1, metric: str = 'euclidean')[source]¶

Bases: object

Class for performing UMAP-based analysis combined with Riemannian geometry.

data¶

Input data to be analyzed.

Type:

numpy.ndarray or pandas.DataFrame

n_neighbors¶

Number of neighbors used for constructing the UMAP KNN graph.

Type:

int

min_dist¶

Minimum distance parameter for UMAP, controlling the tightness of clusters.

Type:

float

metric¶

Distance metric used in UMAP.

Type:

str

umap_similarities¶

Matrix of similarity values derived from the UMAP KNN graph.

Type:

numpy.ndarray, optional

rho¶

Matrix computed as 1 minus the UMAP similarity matrix, used for weighting differences.

Type:

numpy.ndarray, optional

riemannian_diff¶

3D array containing the weighted Riemannian differences between each pair of data points.

Type:

numpy.ndarray, optional

umap_distance_matrix¶

Matrix of distances calculated from the Riemannian differences.

Type:

numpy.ndarray, optional

calculate_rho_matrix() → ndarray[source]¶

Calculates the Rho matrix as 1 minus the UMAP similarity matrix.

Returns:

Rho matrix.

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

Raises:

ValueError – If UMAP similarities have not been calculated.

calculate_umap_distance_matrix() → ndarray[source]¶

Calculates the UMAP distance matrix using weighted Riemannian differences.

Returns:

UMAP distance matrix.

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

Raises:

ValueError – If the Riemannian differences have not been calculated.

calculate_umap_graph_similarities() → ndarray[source]¶

Calculates UMAP similarities based on the KNN connectivity graph.

Returns:

UMAP similarity matrix derived from the KNN graph.

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

riemannian_components(corr_matrix: ndarray) → ndarray[source]¶

Performs Riemannian principal component analysis (PCA) using the supplied correlation matrix.

Parameters:

corr_matrix (numpy.ndarray) – Riemannian correlation matrix.

Returns:

Matrix of principal components.

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

Raises:

ValueError – If the correlation matrix is not square or if its size does not match the number of data columns.

riemannian_components_from_data_and_correlation(corr_matrix: ndarray) → ndarray[source]¶

Performs Riemannian principal component analysis (PCA) using the data and the provided correlation matrix.

Parameters:

corr_matrix (numpy.ndarray) – Correlation matrix of the variables.

Returns:

Matrix of principal components.

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

Raises:

ValueError – If the correlation matrix is not square or if its size does not match the number of data columns.

riemannian_correlation_matrix() → ndarray[source]¶

Calculates the Riemannian correlation matrix from the Riemannian covariance matrix.

Returns:

Riemannian correlation matrix.

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

riemannian_correlation_variables_components(components: ndarray) → DataFrame[source]¶

Calculates the Riemannian correlation between the original variables and the first two components.

Parameters:

components (numpy.ndarray) – Matrix of components (at least two columns are expected).

Returns:

DataFrame with the correlation of each original variable with the first and second components.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

riemannian_covariance_matrix() → ndarray[source]¶

Calculates the covariance matrix using Riemannian differences.

Returns:

Riemannian covariance matrix.

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

Raises:

ValueError – If the UMAP distance matrix has not been calculated.

riemannian_covariance_matrix_general(combined_data: DataFrame) → ndarray[source]¶

Helper method to calculate the Riemannian covariance matrix for a generic dataset.

Parameters:

combined_data (pandas.DataFrame) – Combined data (e.g., original data and components).

Returns:

Riemannian covariance matrix.

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

riemannian_vector_difference() → ndarray[source]¶

Calculates the Riemannian difference between each pair of row vectors in the data matrix.

Returns:

3D array containing the Riemannian differences for each pair of rows.

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

Raises:

ValueError – If the Rho matrix has not been calculated.

riemann_stats_py.utilities module¶

class riemann_stats_py.utilities.Utilities[source]¶

Bases: object

class Utilities[source]¶

Bases: object

Class for common utility functions in data science projects.

This class provides static methods for performing common mathematical and statistical operations that facilitate data analysis tasks.

The methods are designed to be used without requiring instantiation, which simplifies the integration of these tools into larger data processing and analysis workflows.

static pca_inertia_by_components(correlation_matrix: ndarray, component1: int, component2: int) → float[source]¶

Calculates the inertia explained by two specific principal components in a PCA.

Parameters:

  • correlation_matrix (numpy.ndarray) – Correlation matrix of the variables.

  • component1 (int) – Index of the first principal component (based on descending order of explained variance).

  • component2 (int) – Index of the second principal component (based on descending order of explained variance).

Returns:

Inertia explained by the selected principal components.

Return type:

float

Raises:

ValueError – If the correlation matrix is not square or if the component indices are out of range.

riemann_stats_py.visualization module¶

class riemann_stats_py.visualization.Visualization(data: DataFrame, components: ndarray | None = None, explained_inertia: float = 0.0, clusters: ndarray | None = None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Class for visualizing charts related to UMAP and PCA.

data¶

Data used for visualization.

Type:

pandas.DataFrame

components¶

Matrix of principal components.

Type:

numpy.ndarray, optional

explained_inertia¶

Explained inertia percentage.

Type:

float

clusters¶

Array of cluster labels for each data point.

Type:

numpy.ndarray, optional

plot_2d_scatter_with_clusters(x_col: str, y_col: str, cluster_col: str, title: str = '', figsize: Tuple[int, int] = (10, 8)) → None[source]¶

Generates a 2D scatter plot colored by cluster.

Parameters:

  • x_col (str) – Name of the column for the x-axis.

  • y_col (str) – Name of the column for the y-axis.

  • cluster_col (str) – Name of the column containing cluster labels.

  • title (str, optional) – Custom title to add above the default title.

  • figsize (tuple, optional) – Figure size. Defaults to (10, 8).

plot_3d_scatter_with_clusters(x_col: str, y_col: str, z_col: str, cluster_col: str, title: str = '', figsize: Tuple[int, int] = (12, 8), cmap: str = 'viridis', s: int = 50, alpha: float = 0.7) → None[source]¶

Creates a 3D scatter plot colored by cluster.

Parameters:

  • x_col (str) – Name of the column for the x-axis.

  • y_col (str) – Name of the column for the y-axis.

  • z_col (str) – Name of the column for the z-axis.

  • cluster_col (str) – Name of the column containing cluster labels.

  • title (str, optional) – Custom title to add above the default title.

  • figsize (tuple, optional) – Figure size. Defaults to (12, 8).

  • cmap (str, optional) – Colormap to use. Defaults to “viridis”.

  • s (int, optional) – Size of the points. Defaults to 50.

  • alpha (float, optional) – Transparency of the points. Defaults to 0.7.

plot_correlation_circle(correlations: DataFrame, title: str = '', scale: float = 1, draw_circle: bool = True) → None[source]¶

Generates a correlation circle for the principal components.

Parameters:

  • correlations (pandas.DataFrame) – DataFrame containing the correlations for each variable.

  • title (str, optional) – Custom title to add above the default title.

  • scale (float, optional) – Scaling factor for the arrows. Defaults to 1.

  • draw_circle (bool, optional) – Whether to draw the unit circle. Defaults to True.

plot_principal_plane(title: str = '') → None[source]¶

Generates a plot of the principal plane using the principal components.

Parameters:

title (str, optional) – Custom title to add above the default title.

plot_principal_plane_with_clusters(title: str = '') → None[source]¶

Generates a plot of the principal plane with points colored according to clusters.

Parameters:

title (str, optional) – Custom title to add above the default title.

Raises:

ValueError – If cluster information is not provided.

Module contents¶

riemann_stats_py

This package provides tools for Riemannian statistical analysis using UMAP, including: - Data preprocessing - Local distance computations - Riemannian PCA - Interactive visualizations

class riemann_stats_py.DataProcessing[source]¶

Bases: object

Class for handling data loading and preparation.

This class offers static methods to read CSV files and convert them into DataFrames, facilitating data analysis in data science projects.

static load_data(filepath: str, separator: str = ';', decimal: str = '.') → DataFrame[source]¶

Loads data from a CSV file and returns a DataFrame.

This method reads a CSV file using the pandas library. It allows specifying the delimiter and the decimal character, with default values provided for ease of use.

Parameters:

  • filepath (str) – Path to the CSV file.

  • separator (str, optional) – Delimiter used in the CSV file. Defaults to “;”.

  • decimal (str, optional) – Character used for decimal points in the CSV file. Defaults to “.”.

Returns:

A DataFrame containing the data loaded from the CSV file.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

class riemann_stats_py.Utilities[source]¶

Bases: object

class Utilities[source]¶

Bases: object

Class for common utility functions in data science projects.

This class provides static methods for performing common mathematical and statistical operations that facilitate data analysis tasks.

The methods are designed to be used without requiring instantiation, which simplifies the integration of these tools into larger data processing and analysis workflows.

static pca_inertia_by_components(correlation_matrix: ndarray, component1: int, component2: int) → float[source]¶

Calculates the inertia explained by two specific principal components in a PCA.

Parameters:

  • correlation_matrix (numpy.ndarray) – Correlation matrix of the variables.

  • component1 (int) – Index of the first principal component (based on descending order of explained variance).

  • component2 (int) – Index of the second principal component (based on descending order of explained variance).

Returns:

Inertia explained by the selected principal components.

Return type:

float

Raises:

ValueError – If the correlation matrix is not square or if the component indices are out of range.

plot_2d_scatter_with_clusters(x_col: str, y_col: str, cluster_col: str, title: str = '', figsize: Tuple[int, int] = (10, 8)) → None[source]¶

Generates a 2D scatter plot colored by cluster.

  • y_col (str) – Name of the column for the y-axis.

  • cluster_col (str) – Name of the column containing cluster labels.

plot_3d_scatter_with_clusters(x_col: str, y_col: str, z_col: str, cluster_col: str, title: str = '', figsize: Tuple[int, int] = (12, 8), cmap: str = 'viridis', s: int = 50, alpha: float = 0.7) → None[source]¶

Creates a 3D scatter plot colored by cluster.

Parameters:

  • x_col (str) – Name of the column for the x-axis.

  • y_col (str) – Name of the column for the y-axis.

  • z_col (str) – Name of the column for the z-axis.

  • cluster_col (str) – Name of the column containing cluster labels.

  • title (str, optional) – Custom title to add above the default title.

  • figsize (tuple, optional) – Figure size. Defaults to (12, 8).

  • cmap (str, optional) – Colormap to use. Defaults to “viridis”.

  • s (int, optional) – Size of the points. Defaults to 50.

  • alpha (float, optional) – Transparency of the points. Defaults to 0.7.

Generates a correlation circle for the principal components.

  • title (str, optional) – Custom title to add above the default title.

  • scale (float, optional) – Scaling factor for the arrows. Defaults to 1.

  • draw_circle (bool, optional) – Whether to draw the unit circle. Defaults to True.
